THE STEEL TAIL-SPIKE OF THE CELLO
OVER THE SIDE OF THE CLIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DEEP RAVINE slashes through a wooded area that stretche for miles behind picturesque homes. Through the treetops, we glimpse a FEMALE RUNNER on a tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUDDY RUNNING SHOES pound a dirt path. We travel up toned and a trim frame to FACE -- classically beautiful but set with determination. This is CLAIRE PETERSON, 39, though she could pass for ye younger if she’d only lighten up a bit. She speeds up as she approaches a FALLEN SYCAMORE that bl her path. With the grace of a gazelle she leaps over the downed tree and lands in...

dialogues.speaker: A CLEARING
dialogues.text: poised on the brink of the ravine. Quiet. Mossy. A sylvan paradise, complete with a TIRE SWING hanging from a tree. Claire breathes heavily as she stretches against the fall sycamore. Eventually, her gaze wanders to a WEATHERED CAR on its trunk: "C.P. + G.P” encircled in a heart. Her eyes darken. Her watch BEEPS, pulling her back to the present. She hurries off toward a COLONIAL-STYLE HOME in the distance. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - KITCHEN —- MORNING Claire, dressed ina prim skirt and blouse, bustles about clearing the breakfast table. A NEWSCAST plays on a small TV, but Claire doesn’t pay mu attention to it.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In Milwaukee, a jury has convicted a local plumber for the murder of his live-in girlfriend, Marissa Sheldon.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (calling) Kevin! Time to go! A photo of a PRETTY BLONDE WOMAN fills the TV screen. Cla gives it a fleeting glance while filling her commuter mug

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: A beloved teacher at Bay View High, thirty-one year-old Sheldon was found bludgeoned to death in her apartment last spring -- Claire flicks off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Train’s leaving, Kev! Claire shoves a slice of burnt toast between her teeth, g her belongings, and goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire enters from the house, juggling her things. She pushes the GARAGE DOOR OPENER on the wall, but the massiv wooden door doesn’t budge. She pushes it again. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh, not today. She sets her things down and lifts the door manually struggling under its weight. But it immediately ro is bac down, accompanied by a sprinkling of drywall.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Damn it. KEVIN PETERSON, 13, gangly, Elmer's giue complexion, emer from the house lugging a backpack and a CELLO CASE. He surveys the scene and reaches for his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: We better call Dad.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: No! I’ve got it. Claire wedges a ladder under the door. INT. CLAIRE’S SUV - MORNING With Kevin at her side, Claire checks her mirror and back Instantly, they hear the sickening CRUNCH OF METAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire gets out of the SUV and grimaces at the MANGLED LUGGAGE RACK on top, the garage door too low by a matter millimeters. Kevin gets out, his eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Oh, man.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Just get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A majestic brick butiding atop a sprawling lawn. SUVs str through the gated entry decorated with a “Welcome Back!” Claire’s SUV pulls in, the luggage rack secured by a bung cord and duct tape.  INT. CLAIRE’S SUV (MOVING) - DAY Claire maneuvers through the parking lot where EXCITED TE greet each other after a long summer apart. Kevin spots ALLIE CAMBRIDGE, 17, beauty pageant material, laughing with girlfriends. Claire notices his eyes follow her as they drive past. Claire starts to turn into a parking space when an acne-s tough-guy, JASON ZIMMER, 18, steps into her path, rough-h with some boys. Kevin shrinks at the sight of Jason. Claire waits for him pass, then parks. CLAIRE . . You have any problem with him --

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Mom. I can handle it. Kevin gets out and trudges toward the building. Claire watches him disappear in her mirror, then gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks among throngs of STUDENTS, greeting them wit genuine affection. VICKY LANSING, 35, shapely and wearing tight clothes to p it, comes up alongside her.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Ready for the little bastards?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: A bit hostile for the first day.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Why wait? It’s going to come to that soon enough. Vicky pulls a chunk of drywall from Claire’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Prowling construction sites in your spare time?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: That garage door is acting up again.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Ethan's got a hot buddy who’s incredibly handy with “domestic repairs.”

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: If you change your mind, I’m sure this guy could get it up for you.  Claire laughs and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I’1l take that as a solid maybe. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLASSROOM — DAY Claire enters as the bell rings. BOISTEROUS STUDENTS reluctantly take their seats.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: For those of you who don’t know me, I’m Mrs. Peterson. Welcome to Ancient Greek Literature. Moans from some of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I know. Torture, right? Trust me, you ain’t seen nothin’ yet. On a large screen she projects a DRAWING of ancient Greek forcing a man into a large HOLLOW BRASS BULL.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: This, my friends, is the brazen bull. A little torture device conjured up by the ancient Greeks to roast criminals alive. And just to amp up the creepy factor, they put a network of pipes inside so the victim’s screams would sound like the bellowing of an infuriated bull.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS STUDENTS
dialogues.text: Eeewww... Disgusting ... Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: They were pretty sick and twisted back then. Lucky for us, they wrote about it. She sits on her desk and makes eye contact with each of t

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Jealousy - Ambition. Greed. Lust. Thousands of years ago, the Greeks were intimately familiar with the dark side of human nature. I’m betting that by the end of this class, you will be too. She scans their riveted faces and knows she’s got them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next door, BURLY MEN unload furniture from a moving truck Claire’s SUV pulls in. Claire and Kevin get out and crane see the activity.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I wonder who’s moving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a cute girl your age. Kevin rolls his eyes and goes inside. Claire follows with chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire loads the dishwasher: two plates, two glasses, two She sorts through the mail, tossing aside envelopes addre GARY PETERSON. She comes to one addressed to her from “Th Offices of Sharon Atkinson.” She opens it and finds a PETITION FOR DIVORCE with a note attached: "Sign ASAP so I can file on your behalf.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, ina nightgown y brushes her teeth. She glimpses herself in a full length mirror. She pulls up her nightgown and stares with clinical detachment at her buttocks, turning to catch every angle. She drops her nightgown and spits into the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire peers out at the newly occupied house next door. A light shines through the SEMI-SHEER CURTAINS in the windo directly across from hers. Suddenly, behind the curtains a MALE SILHOUETTE appears, removing his shirt over his head. Claire draws her curtai She gets into bed ecargfut not to disturb the other side, turns out the ligh She buries her face in the pillow next to hers and smells “he. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Vicky browse in the shoe department.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: So file the damn thing already.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I will. I’m just not there yet.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What you need is somebody to get ou there. A hot stud who's gonna arge in and shake you up and make you feel ... you know ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Desirable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking more like horny. It’s meant as a joke but Claire remains gloomy.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You are desirable. He just had his head too far up his ass to appreciate it. Vicky stops at a the sale rack, while Claire wanders over display of SEXY STILETTOS. Claire picks up one of the stilettos and stares at it, ca by its raw sex appeal. A SALESMAN approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Can I bring you your size?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh no. These aren’t really my --

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (to the Salesman) She takes a seven. INT. CLAIRE’S SUV (MOVING) - DAY Claire drives as Vicky touches up her makeup in the mirro

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I‘ll never wear them.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: We'll see ... Claire pulls into her driveway and sees a TEENAGE BOY pla basketball with Kevin. He’s tall and well-developed -- mo man in appearance than a boy. This is NOAH SANDBORN, 17.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I have no idea. They watch as he dribbles circles around Kevin, his every flexing. Vicky scrambles out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky approaches as Noah shoots a perfect layup.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Bravo! Both boys turn to her, and for the first time we clearly  NOAH’S FACE Magnetic eyes. Confident smile. Boyish, yet possessing a quality that suggests an old soul living deep inside.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Hey Vicky. Vicky ignores Kevin and zeroes in on Noah.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Hi there. Vicky Lansing.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Noah Sandborn. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: The pleasure is all mine. Claire walks up.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Noah, this is my mom. (to Claire Noah just moved in next door. From Milwaukee.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Welcome to the neighborhood, Noah. Noah’s eyes come alive as they take Claire in.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, Mrs. Peterson.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh please, call me Claire.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Noah’s gonna be a senior at Wilkerson.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: No kidding. you must be what? Eighteen Si rescys

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Not until June.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Okay, Vicky. Why don’t we let the boys play? Claire Vicky into the house. Noah watches them go with mo than mild interest. Kevin notices.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, Vicky's something, isn’t she? All the guys call her “The Second Coming.” Get it?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: That’s pretty rude, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I didn’t mean it like --

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Chill, bro. Just messin’ with you. Noah steals the ball from Kevin and slam dunks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sorts laundry when she hears the sound of a car pu in. She looks out to the driveway. Her face darkens. GARY PETERSON, 45, gets out of a BLACK MERCEDES. Athletic slightly graying , he’s the picture of success in his Arm -- until you glimpse the melancholy look in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire swings the door open just before Gary knocks.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Kevin called. Said the garage door was broken.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’ve already scheduled someone to come out.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’m here. Let me take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary stands on ladder and pokes around inside the motor o garage door opener. Claire watches from below, arms folde

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Motor’s not burned out. Hand me a Phillips head, would you? She does, her eyes travelling the lines of his buttocks.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I thought you were out of town.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Just a quick trip to meet with a new client. Let’s see if that did it. He climbs down and pushes the button. The door rises.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: There we go ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your meeting. Where was it?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: New York. Claire lets out a disgusted laugh.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I didn’t see her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: We're separated, Gary. You’re free to see whomever you want.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We’re still married as far as I'm concerned. And I don’t have any interest in seeing her or anybody else. I _haven’t been with anyone this whole time. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Wow, what a feat. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Don’t be like that.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Like what, Gary? You want me to believe every. word that comes out of your mouth? I tried that. Didn’t exactly work out.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Claire ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help with the door. GARY. Tell Kevin I’1l call him about the camping trip. Gary trudges out the garage door. Claire pushes the remot button and the door descends between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire cuts ROSES from a hedge in her driveway when Noah comes out of his house with a MAN, 55, in a suit and tie. Claire watches from behind the hedge as they walk to an A parked in Noah’s driveway.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Promise you'll call me if there’s any problem?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Don’t worry.  10.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You’re going to love Wilkerson. Just wait. You’ll have a slew of friends before you know it. Their conversation becomes inaudible as the man gives Noa affectionate slap on the back and gets into his car. Noah waves as the man drives off. He heads back to the ho and spots Claire, who pretends to be minding her own busi

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Hey, Claire. Those are some roses. Floribundas, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m impressed.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: My mom studied horticulture in college. Rubbed off, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Maybe she can tell me how to get rid of these brown edges.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: She died a few years ago in a car accident.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh... I’m gorry It’s just you and your dad, then? She nods to where the car had been parked.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. But he travels a lot for work, so I’m pretty much on my own.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You must get lonely.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I’m used to it. You get used to anything if you have to. He suddenly looks bereft, weary. Claire smiles with empat

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Well, see you around. Noah heads back to his house. Claire watches him go, motherly concern in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Hey, Noah? You’re welcome to join us for dinner tonight. Noah turns to her with a smile.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Kevin watch with amusement as Noah devours his

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You didn’t tell me your mom was such an incredible cook. I might have to crash dinner every night.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You’re welcome anytime. Claire spoons more potatoes onto Noah's plate, her BREAST with the motion. Noah’s eyes take them in.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: So I hear your Ancient Greek Literature class is pretty amazing.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Then you haven’t heard her nickname.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin ...

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Seriously, they call her the “The Crusher.”

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: (to Claire) You cover Homer? He’s my favorite.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Dude, you ever read the Iliad Achilles is this total bad ass. Hot-tempered, full of pride, totally consumed by his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Which proved to be his downfall.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Downfall? The guy was one of the greatest warriors of all time. People have been talking about him for centuries from Dante and Shakespeare to Zeppelin and Dylan. He’s in comic books, video games, movies -- every modern day medium there is. Hell, I‘1l take that kind of failure any day.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Wow, man. You’re really into it. Claire’s eyes gleam -- finally a kid who gets it.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: (to Claire) You think I_got_a shot at getting into your class?  12.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It’s an honors class. Involves a ton of work. You think you can handle it?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Oh, absolutely. Noah grins enthusiastically, ready for any challenge.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do. INT. CLAIRE’S SUV (MOVING) - MORNING Claire drives while Kevin and Noah sit in back playing wi their iPhones. Kevin notices NOAH’S SCREEN, which display custom themes and applications.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (re: Noah’s iPhone) Dude, what the heck?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I jailbroke it. That’s how I get all my cool apps. Kevin watches with fascination as Noah starts up a strang party application.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Is that legal?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: It voids the warranty, but it’s legal. I’11 show you how after school if you want.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Here we are. Claire pulls through the Wilkerson Prep gates. Noah looks out the window at the manicured grounds. He smiles with deep satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kevin pulls his cello from the back of the SUV, Claire Noah’s tie hanging loose around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You'll get detention if that’s not tied properly.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I tried. I’ve just never gotten the hang of it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Here.  13. Claire straightens Noah’s collar, her fingers brushing ag his skin.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Chin up a little. She wraps and loops the tie, her face close to his. He ga at her eyelashes, her lips.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: There you go. Perfect. She smooths the tie and smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Thank you. Their eyes linger on each other for_a long moment, someth passing between them. Claire’s smile slowly fades.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: We're going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Yes. Better get going.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Come on. I’11 show you around. They head off. Claire blinks, unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah follows Kevin, who grapples with his cello case thro of students.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Need a hand?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I got it. Kevin consults a slip of paper and leads Noah to a locker

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Here it is. Noah works the combination when Jason Zimmer comes around corner, a couple of his STOOGES in tow. He spots Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Whatcha got in the case, Geek Boy?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Come on, Jason.

dialogues.speaker: STOOGE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s a AK47.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: That right? You goin’ Columbine on us?  14.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Believe me Zimmer, you’d be the first to know.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Oh, Geek Boy’s trying to be funny. You think you’re funny? Huh? Jason grabs the cello, but Kevin hangs on tight. They grapple with it amidst hoots and from the stooges. Suddenly, a HAND goes to Jason's neck.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Let go. Jason writhes in Noah’s vice grips then finally releases cello. Noah shoves him, nearly sending him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What the -- Jason wheels around ready for battle, but the cold-bloode in Noah’s eyes instantly unnerves him.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Fuck with him, you fuck with me. Noah slams his locker and saunters off. Kevin gives Jason shit-eating grin and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Vicky enter the food line.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t you know I got friggin’ Cameron Knopf in my class. “He’s just as big a tard as his older brother. Claire's eyes drift to the dining room where she spots Al Cambridge flirting mercilessly with Noah.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You'd think those parents would see what they got the first time around and be scared shitless to reproduce again. Claire watches their interaction with a proprietary look. Vicky follows her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Figures she'd sniff him out on day one. Like a dog to raw meat. Vicky chuckles, but Claire turns and walks the other way.  15. INT. CLAIRE’S SUV (MOVING) - DAY Claire drives with Kevin beside her and Noah in back. Kev spots Jason Zimmer lighting up a cigarette as he ambles d the street with his friends.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: There he goes, douche bag.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Well he is and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Did something happen?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: It was no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Noah) You should have seen his face when you grabbed him, man. He looked like he was gonna pee his pants.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Better be careful, Noah. Jason’s not someone you want as your enemy.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: He’s not as tough as he thinks. Claire smiles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: So how about friends? You make any of those today, Noah?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I saw you talking to Allie Cambridge in the cafeteria. She studies him in the mirror, but his face gives away no

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Man, I’ve been working up the nerve to talk to her for a year and you do it your first day.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: She’s a very pretty girl.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Very. She's just not my type.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Dude, she’s every guy’s type.  16.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: She’s a little immature, that’s all. Noah’s eyes meet Claire’s in the mirror. She quickly look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, dressed ina nightgown turns down the bed. She goe to draw the curtains and sees Noah reading in the window across from hers. Noah looks up, smiles and waves. Claire waves back, embarrassed, and closes her curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stretches, dressed for a run.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Morning. She turns and sees Noah in his driveway in sweats and sne

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Noah.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I see you out here every morning. Thought maybe you could show me the best trail. She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: But I don’t want to intrude on your private time or anything ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Think you can keep up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Noah run side by side, their feet pounding in along the path we’ve seen Claire travel. When they near t clearing, Claire points to the fallen sycamore.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: There’s the finish. She sprints ahead and leaps over the tree, showing off. N follows. Claire trots in place, gulping water. Noah bends over, gulping air.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Oh man ... you do this everyday?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Rain or shine.  17. Noah hangs on the tire swing and watches Claire stretch against the fallen sycamore.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: It’s nice here. Peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Better stretch or you'll be sorry tomorrow. Noah joins her at the tree, positioning himself near the carving of Claire’s and Gary’s initials.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: re: the carving) You do this?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin’s dad. Back when the tree was still standing.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Talk about symbolism. CLAIRE . Yeah, funny the way things work out.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Kevin said there’s a chance you two might get back together.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m sure that’s what every kid whose parents split up hopes for.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Well, you never know. My mom and dad Almost got divorced but they worked it out in the end.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: There are some things that can’t be worked out. Noah watches her as she struggles to hide her pain.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You’‘re not really over him, are you?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Well, this place is obviously special to you --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Was -—

dialogues.text: Well, I mean let’s face it. How many kids are really ofi2g, to use what they learn in assical Studies?” As he speaks, Travis’s eyes flit to a CURVACEOUS WOMAN in SKINTIGHT SKIRT who gets up from a nearby table. It’s bar a glimpse, but Claire notices.
