dialogues.text: (calling) You want coffee?

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Only if you're having some. She fills a coffee pot with water when ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire tenses. Turns off the tap. She can hear Gary’s voi but not his words. She picks up the tray with the cake an pushes through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at the table with Gary and Kevin is Noah. They la together like old friends. ey look up at Claire standing frozen in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Wow. Doesn’t that look tasty? Claire crosses the threshold with a wavering smile.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Noah. How are you? Gary, this is our new neighbor, Noah.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yes, we've met. He brought over a part for the bathroom sink.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh. Claire quickly turns her attention to cutting the cake.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: (to Gary) I don’t know much about plumbing, but that pipe looked pretty bad. You’1l have to take a look.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Jk Claire) Why didn’t you tell me it was leaking?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Well it ... just started ... while you were gone.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: (to Claire Did you tell him about what happened last night? Claire looks up from the cake to Noah. His eyes toy with

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: With the garage door?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes. I almost forgot. It’s on the fritz again.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You're kidding me. I just fixed the damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: They don’t make them like they used to. That’s what my dad always says.  36.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (re: Gary) That’s what he says, too. Every chance he gets.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Because it’s true. Claire hands out plates of cake, then sits next to Gary rather than in her original seat, which is now next to No Gary helps Claire with her chair, then casually drapes hi across its back, giving Claire’s shoulder a squeeze. Noah’s jaw clenches ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Noah) So what I miss while I was gone? Anything big?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I'll say ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) We had a huge thunderstorm on Friday night. Did you guys get it up there?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No, dry as a bone at the lake.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: It was pretty intense here.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Noah) Did you go to McMullin’s party?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Nah. Had better things to do.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Like what? Noah opens his mouth to speak but Claire again interrupts

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I had dinner with Vicky. That new sushi restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh? How was it? Claire speaks to Gary but looks at Noah, her words meant warning to him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t recommend it.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Really? I heard it’s pretty good.  37.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Trust me, you don’t want to go there. Claire takes a drink of water, glowering at Noah over her top of her glass. He returns her gaze. A standoff. Finally, Noah gets to his feet. Noah goes

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Well, it’s getting late.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: It’s only nine.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Don’t you have homework, Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah but --

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I do too, actually. Great to meet you, Mr. Peterson. Let me know if you want any help with that garage door.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks Noah. May take you up on that.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow, Kev. Mrs. Peterson. out the door.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Nice kid. Claire clatters the plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire washes the dishes. Gary enters with a corroded pip

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: He was right. Caught it just in time. Gary grabs a towel and dries. They work in silence, side

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So, I’ve been thinking about getting a new job. Something where I could cut back on my travel. Handle local deals.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh Gary, no. You’ve worked too hard to give it all up like that.

dialogues.speaker: . GARY
dialogues.text: I just thought if I weren’t gone so much ...  38.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It was never about that.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: But it was. Don’t You see? We grew apart. I’m willing to do whatever it takes to fix this. I just want to come home.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I don’t know ...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It was a mistake, Claire. People make mistakes. His words resonate with her now. She turns to him, a flic of compassion in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I know. I need some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire pours herself a cup of coffee as teachers bustle i and out. She spots Noah and Kevin out on the field talkin to Allie. She watches them. A HAND gudden ly goes to her shoulder. Claire jumps, slos her coffee. e turns to see Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Damn it.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Claire dabs herself with napkins. Vicky sees Noah outside

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Enjoying the view, I see.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Don’t start. VICKY. Jeez, you're a little uptight. For an instant Claire looks like she might confide in her but the moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m late for class. Claire hurries out the door. Vicky watches her go. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Claire enters just as the bell rings.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Okay, take your seats.  39. She pulls some papers from her briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’ve graded your quizzes. Overall you did a very nice job. They hoot with victory, but are soon interrupted by HEADMASTER EDWARD WARREN, 50s, who enters without knockin

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Mr. Warren. What a pleasant -- She stops cold when she sees Noah entering behind him.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Good news. I’ve approved Noah's transfer to your class. (to Noah Find yourself a seat, son.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Carry on. Headmaster Warren goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire follows Headmaster Warren out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, wait ... He turns impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: We've already covered quite a bit of material ...

dialogues.speaker: . HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: You said yourself when you requested the transfer --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I didn’t request the transfer. I merely identified him as a possible candidate.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: And you assured me he’s a bright boy. His transcript bears you out. I’m sure he’1ll manage to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: But ...

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: You can work with him after school until he does.  40. He turns and walks off. INT. PETERSON HOUSE —- FAMILY ROOM - EVENING Kevin and Noah play a DEATHMATCH VIDEOGAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of killing fill the air as Claire sets the table f

dialogues.speaker: / CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Would you come here?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In a minute!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Now, please. She waits anxiously until he appears.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What? I’m in the middle of this.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Dinner’s ready. Time for you to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I told him he could stay.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Because ... he’s been here all day.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I just think we should have some family time --

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: God, what _is your problem? First you're all “mi casa es su casa” and now you’re kicking him out?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m not kicking him out --  41.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Look, I’ve already invited him. If you don’t want him here, you can tell him yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, Kevin and Noah sit at the dinner table, the air t

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Another delicious dinner, Claire. I like what you’ve done with your potatoes this time. She doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: So Kev. What do you think about Allie Cambridge?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: She asked me oie if you're saoing to Homecoming with anyone. thinks you’re “cute.” Claire’s eyes dart to Noah with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: No way. ; NOAH . Seriously, man, she’s into you.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What’d you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I said you were considering several prospects. Kevin laughs uproariously.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You know how lucky you are? She could have anyone, but she chose you. When a girl gives you an opening like that, you got to jump on it. Isn’t that right, Claire? She looks up at him, her voice cold, her eyes even colder

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It’s up to Kevin. She gets to her feet and empties her plate into the dispo

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Put your dishes in the sink when you’re finished. She walks out.  42. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Rain pummels the windows as Claire works alone at her des Vicky enters with a FLOWER ARRANGEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Looks like Gary’s up to his old tricks again.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh, aren’t they gorgeous? She opens the card: “Please give me another chance.”

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: He wants to get back together.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: And? You told him no fucking way, right?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I said I’d think about it.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: So that’s it? He drops a bundle at FTD and you melt like some lovesick schoolgirl? I can’t believe you’re falling for this bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’ve been married to this man for seventeen years, Vicky. You haven't had a relationship last more than six months. Maybe it’s time you worry about yourself for a change. Vicky steps back, sunned by her venom. Claire’s edge soft

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: He messed up, okay? Everybody does. Sometimes you have to try to get past it.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I sure as hell hope you know what you're doing. She walks out. Claire picks up her cellphone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with a noisy lunch crowd. Gary dines with several businessmen when his phone rings. He sees it’s Claire.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. He moves to an equally loud LOBBY AREA and answers.  43.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Hi. INTERCUT with Claire in her classroom

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Did I catch you at a bad time?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I_wanted to thank you for the flowers. They’re beautiful. He presses his finger to his free ear.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I said thank you. For the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Flowers? She’s struck silent, her mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Claire?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You know what? I’ve got to go. Let me call you back. Claire hangs up and glares at the flowers. She picks them and stuffs them into the waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still raining. Kids huddle under the eaves waiting for ri Claire pulls up in the SUV and honks. Kevin runs toward h INT. CLAIRE’S SUV - DAY As soon as Kevin hops in, Claire pulls away from the curb

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Hey, what about Noah?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: We drove him this morning. How's he gonna get home?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: If he wanted a ride, he should have been out here on time.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: But he’s counting on -- She looks at him in the rearview mirror, her face stern.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m not arguing with you about this, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Look out! Claire looks to the road and sees Noah standing directly front of them. She slams on the brakes, missing him by a Noah and Claire exchange an intense look through the rain streaked windshield. Kevin opens the door, calls to Noah.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Come on. Get in. Noah gets into the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Sorry, Man. We didn’t think you were coming.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: My fault for being late. His eyes meet Claire’s in the rear view mirror. Accusing her. Claire’s eyes dart away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire pulls in. Kevin and Noah jump out with their backp and run into the house. Claire sits there watching the ra before forcing herself to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire enters to find Noah waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Claire --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You need to go home. Claire heads toward the kitchen but Noah blocks her way.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I think you know.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (calling) Mom, are there any more of those quesadillas?  45.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (calling to Kevin) Be right there.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: No, I don’t. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Those flowers, Noah. What were you even thinking?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: They were a peace offering.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You expect me to believe that?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Well, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Okay, assuming that’s what it was, did you think for one minute about how it would look? A student sending a teacher flowers?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: That’s why I didn’t sign the card.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: you're a real piece of work, soa now that?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe sending flowers was a bad idea. But give me a break. I have no idea what you want me to do here.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I want you to stop it! (lowering her voice) I want you to forget any of this ever happened.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Claire, listen --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: No. I don’t want talk about this again, Noah. Not ever. And from now on, you’re to call me "Mrs. Peterson.” She turns and walks out. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - MASTER BEDROOM —- NIGHT Claire reads in bed when she hears the sound of pebbles hitting the window. She gets up and sees Gary down in the yard. “She opens the window.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Gary? What in the world ...?  46.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to wake Kev.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door, Gary presents Claire with a BOUQUET OF GARDE

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh Gary, they’re gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: And it’s not just because some other guy beat me to it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: There is no other guy. Another teacher’s flowers were delivered to me by mistake, that’s all.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Guess I should take it as a_good sign you thought they were from me. She fills a vase with water. He hovers, gazing at her nightgown, her freshly scrubbed face.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Were you asleep?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Just reading a little. He moves close, runs his hand along her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss seeing you like this. They hold a long look, then fall into a passionate kiss. Gary’ s hands travel down Claire’s back to her buttocks. pulls her against him. Their breathing becomes heavy. Claire opens her eyes for just a second and sees:

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: watching them through the window of the back door. His fa is tight, his eyes menacing. Claire pushes Gary away. Gary turns and spots Noah. And in that instant, Noah's sullen expression changes to a sheepish grin. Gary swings the door open.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Hey, Noah.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Peterson. So sorry to interrupt, but I think I left my cell phone here.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It’s a little late.  47.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I know, but I saw the light and my dad's supposed to call from Qatar. Before Claire can protest, Noah heads into the adjoining room.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Qatar? What’s he doing there?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Some big hotel development he’s working on. Noah bends down in front of the couch, blocking Claire’s Gary's view of him, and searches the cushions. He slips t phone out of his pocket and drops it underneath the couch

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Here it is. Noah holds up the phone triumphantly and returns to the kitchen where he spots Gary’s flowers.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Nice flowers.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Gardenias. Claire’s favorite. Gary wraps his arm around Claire’s waist and kisses her. smiles, uncomfortable, and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: __ NOAH
dialogues.text: Even nicer than the ones you got at school today.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I was just telling Mr. Peterson that ebaes were delivered to me by mistake.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Oh ... right.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You got a girlfriend, Noah?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: A good-looking guy like you? You probably have your pick of them.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I've got my eye on someone at schoo But she doesn’t seem interested.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Don’t let that stop you. She's probably just playing hard to get: Women love to make us guys suffer.  48.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Gary. It’s late. I’m sure Noah needs to get to sleep. Gary glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Me too. Big meeting in the morning. He gives Claire a peck.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: See you later. (to Noah) Come on kiddo. He puts his arm around Noah’s shoulder and escorts him ou Noah glances back at Claire, his eyes dark. Claire shuts door behind them. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Claire sits on her desk in front of her students, holding of “OEDIPUS THE KING.” She avoids eye contact with Noah.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: So what do you think Sophocles was trying to teach the Greeks through this play? Noah raises his hand, but Claire searches for someone els She sees Allie whispering to the girl next to her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Allie.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: Ummm ... I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Give it a shot.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: Maybe ... that you can’t change your fate?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Yes, Allie, excellent. Throughout the story we see Oedipus trying to avoid his fate. Yet it continually catches up with him, doesn’t it? Noah raises his hand again, but Claire ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: So perhaps the story is meant to show how powerless man is against the gods.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I had a different take on the whole thing.  49. Claire visibly stiffens at the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I think Oedipus’s downfall was caused by everybody turning a blind eye to the facts. I mean, we all know you can’t ignore the truth for long before it comes back and bites you in the ass. His tone is confrontational, his smile taunting. As Claire struggles to maintain her composure, the bell r and students jump to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: We’1l continue this tomorrow. The class files out while Claire erases the board. But No lingers. When the last student is gone, he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You kept blowing me off. He whips out a paper from his binder.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: And a “D” on the essay?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You didn’t write about the topic I assigned. You’re lucky I didn’t give you an “F.” She gathers up her things and goes for the door. He follo

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Did you even read it? My topic was way better than the one you gave.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: That’s beside the point. You need to learn to follow the rules, Noah. He grabs her arm before she makes it out the door.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Oh, like you do?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Let go of me. He does, reluctantly. She hurries out.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah storms out of Claire’s classroom, balling up the ess in his fist. A STUDENT calls out his name, but he ignores him and keeps going, his face enraged. He turns the corner and spots Kevin, his back pressed up against the lockers by Jason Zimmer, who swats him upside head every time he opens his mouth to speak. Noah’s look turns rabid. He charges at Jason, grabs him b the collar and slams him, face first, into the lockers.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s okay. He was just -- But Noah bashes Jason’s face with his fist, an absolute l of madness in his of es. Kevin watches with a combination horror and awe. er students gather at a distance. Jason lands a punch or two, but he’s no match for Noah's torrent of fury. Soon enough, Jason falls to the floor, f down, barely moving. Noah pulls Jason's head up by the hair and hisses into hi

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: He’s mine. Understand? Jason blinks, utterly confused. Noah lets Jason’s head drop to the floor, then gives him kick in the gut for good measure. He turns to Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Give it all you got.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: No. It’s enough.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Pussy. Just like your old man. He turns and stalks off. Kevin stares after him. INT. WILKERSON PREP - HEADMASTER’S OFFICE - DAY Claire enters to find Kevin slumped in a chair. Mr. Warre paces in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Noah Sandborn and Jason Zimmer exchanged blows earlier this morning. Noah is in the nurse’s office and Jason is on his way to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin? Were you involved in this?  51.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: It appears he’s the only bystander who saw how the fight started. So I’m counting on him to enlighten me. Kevin sits mute, wanting no part of this.

dialogues.speaker: / CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin? Kevin looks to the floor, silent.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Then I have no choice but to suspend both of them.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Jason was being a jerk to me again. Noah tried to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: He told Zimmer to knock it off. That’s when Zimmer popped him.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: So Jason threw the first punch? You're absolutely certain?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Noah was only defending himself. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - KEVIN’S ROOM - NIGHT Kevin brushes his teeth. Claire knocks, then enters.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I think we should talk.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Jason has been suspended for a week. Kevin shrugs, spits.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I realize what a tough spot Mr. Warren and I put you in. It would have been hard to rat on Noah if he’d been the one who started that fight.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What’s gonna happen to Noah?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: A_week’s detention. And he’s not allowed to go to Homecoming.  52.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: He wasn’t going anyway. He gets into bed.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: This suspension will go on Jason's permanent record. Just_as he’s applying to colleges. It could really hurt his future.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah well, sometimes you get what you deserve. He rolls away from her. She lingers, wanting to say more. But she turns out the light and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire runs along the ravine, pushing herself, working of steam. As usual, she leaps over the fallen sycamore in th clearing, completing her run. Breathing deeply, she stretches against the fallen sycamo when she spots: THE CARVING OF HER AND GARY’S INITIALS. It’s been gouged out with a knife. Completely obliterated Claire stares at it, agitated, her mind racing. Suddenly, a BRANCH CRACKS somewhere behind her, the sound echoing through the trees. She whirls around and scans the woods. Nothing -- not eve squirrel. Thoroughly spooked, she turns and runs toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire emerges from the woods into her backyard when she Noah’s father in his driveway getting into his Audi.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (calling) Mr. Sandborn! Claire hurries to catch him, but by the time she gets to house, he’s already heading down the street. Claire runs inside and returns with her keys. She hops in her car and heads in the same direction. INT. CLAIRE’S SUV (MOVING) - DAY Claire drives, searching for the Audi. She comes to a bus intersection and spots it sitting at a light a couple of to her left. She changes lanes to make the turn when her changes red. She slams on the brakes.  53.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Damn it. After a moment, the Audi gets a green light and continues Claire waits impatiently for hers to turn.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Come on .... When her light turns green, she guns it, cutting in front oncoming traffic to make the left-hand turn. Now she has some serious catching up to do. She weaves in and out, but heavy traffic keeps her at a distance. Without warning, the Audi turns and pulls into a parking garage underneath a fifteen-story OFFICE BUILDING. Claire immediately changes lanes. Horns honk, tires squea She’s forced to drive past the building. She parks illegally and rushes toward the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire enters and scans the bustling crowd. She spots Noa father heading to an elevator, his back to her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (calling) Mr. Sandborn! She catches up to him just as he’s about to board.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Please, I need to speak to you. Claire puts her hand to his shoulder and he turns to face her. To her astonishment, it’s a complete STRANGER.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I thought you were ... He gets on the elevator and the doors close between them. Claire turns back to the vast atrium teaming with people. But Mr. Sandborn is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheesy decorations. Loud, thumping music. Students dresse in semi-formal attire bump and grind. Claire and Vicky stand against a wall, acting as chaperon Vicky watches Kevin and Allie dance. Kevin is awkward and too enthusiastic. Allie tries hard not to look embarrasse

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Kevin certainly has come out of his shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep asking myself what she’s doing with him.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What? He’s sweet, he’s smart ... He’s got a lot of potential.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I don’t think most girls that a e, put too much stock in “potentia Especially girls like that.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was sure she had Noah in her Sights. A long beat as she studies Claire.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Speaking of Noah ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I don’t want you to take my head off or anything, but ... I heard a couple of girls talking. Claire turns to her, alarmed. Just gossipy “palishit, But they seem to be under the impression that you two are quite the item.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (chuckling And after I called dibs on him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Vicky. This is serious.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh_come on. You know how kids talk. I can’t even count the number of times I’ve heard rumors like that about me. I just thought you should know. A GIRL comes up to them.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson? We’re out of punch.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I’l1l go.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: No. I could use a breather.  55. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CAFETERIA —- NIGHT Empty. Dark. The dance music is distant and hollow. Claire’s heels echo. A NOISE. She stops. Listens. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire pulls open the HEAVY STEEL DOOR and_flicks on the light. Her breath forms a cloud in the cold air. She spot a jug of punch on a shelf and goes for it. Suddenly, the door SLAMS SHUT. She Jumps, startled. She looks around. She’s all alone, b somehow it doesn’t feel like it. She grabs the punch and rushes to the door. But the handl doesn’t budge. With rising panic, she jiggles the handle bangs on the door. Finally, the handle clicks and turns. She flings the door open and runs out, letting it slam shut behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire hurries back to the gym when Noah steps out from a dark corner. His eye is swollen from the fight.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to be here.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: We need to talk. He pulls her into a shadowy alcove. Claire tries to get a but he shoves her up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Your behavior has been completely unacceptable.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: My behavior --

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: So that shit-head husband of yours suddenly wants to come crawling back and you decide you don’t need me anymore? You’re just done with me?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I thought we agreed --

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: We didn’t agree! You agreed! And suddenly I’m nothing to you. Like what we had never even happened!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Just calm down and listen --  56.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I’m good for you, Claire. I can take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I don’t need you to --

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You do need me. Kevin needs me. Who got him a date for the dance? Who handled Jason Zimmer? Would Gary have done that? Big man can’t even fix the fucking garage door! He pounds his fist into the wall next to her head. She winces with fear.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry but ... I love you. And I know you love me. You’re just scared ... He presses up against her and tries kissing her. She push him away. Undeterred, he goes for her again. This time, s SLAPS HIM hard across the face. He stares at her, stunned

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It was one night. It’s not love. Suddenly, the gym door bangs open off-screen and students LAUGHTER fills the hall.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Stay away from me, Noah. And Kevin, too. She rushes back into the gym. Noah remains in the shadows his jaw clenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allie parks in front of the Peterson house. Kevin, in the passenger seat, looks to the light glowing in the window.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: She waiting up for you?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Na. I pretty much come and go as I please. He cringes at how ridiculous that sounded.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Anyway 1 I had a really good time tonight.

dialogues.speaker: __ ALLIE
dialogues.text: (polite) Yeah, me too. He pulls a CD from his breast pocket and hands it to her.  57.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: For you.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: It’s me. My music, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: Okay ...

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Go ahead ... play it.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: Now? Kevin slips the disk into the car’s CD player. A METALLIC SONG played by a string quartet pours from the speakers. It’s astonishingly good.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: This is you?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: On the cello.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: You're pretty good. He smiles, embarrassed but delighted.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I’d like to play professionally some day. That’s my dream anyway.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for going with me ... and driving ... He leans in and gives her a tender kiss. She blinks with surprise and kisses him back.

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, no problem. Kevin gets out of the car, but becomes tangled up in the belt. “He shuts the door and looks through the open windo

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Well, good night. Allie waves and pulls away. A stunned smile broadens acro Kevin's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire makes a cup of tea. Kevin enters, adrenaline pumpi  58.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: So, how’d it go?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: She’s really cool. I mean she just ets it, you know? And you should ave seen how much she dug my music.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You let her listen to your music?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I gave her a CD.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Wow, Kev. That’s ... big. He sees the wariness in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Nothing ...

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You don’t like her, do you?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Of course I do --

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Noah said you wouldn’t.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Well Noah’s wrong. I just ... I know she dates a lot of boys. And I don’t want you to be disappointed --

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: God, you can’t just let me enjoy this for one minute, can you?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, I didn’t mean to --

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Fine, whatever. He turns and stomps up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MULCHER ROARS as Claire stuffs armfuls of leaves into i mouth. She watches them being chewed to bits. A HAND suddenly touches her shoulder. Startled, she spins around to find Gary. She shuts off the machine.  59.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You scared me to death.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Sorry. I called your name. Is Kev ready? Her face is blank.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: The game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Gary enter.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’ve got an extra ticket. Thought Kev might want to invite Noah.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh ... I don’t think Noah’s around.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: His car is out there.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I saw him leave a little while ago. Someone picked him up.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Too bad. I hate for this thing to go to waste.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Maybe you can sell it.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Maybe you’d like to come along. There’s no hiding the hope in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, Gary, and Kevin, dressed in a Chicago Blackhawks Jersey, get into Gary’s car. As they pull away, NOAH WATCHES them from his bedroom win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackhawks versus Sabres. Claire, Gary and Kevin sit clos to the ice.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You cold?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m fine.  60.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You’ve got goose bumps all over. Gary puts his jacket around Claire’s shoulders and rubs h arms. She allows herself to sink into him just a little. Gary spots a BEER VENDOR and flags him down.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Two over here. Gary passes a beer to Claire. She sips it judiciously. Ga takes a sip of his own, then hands his cup to Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You can’t give him that.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: A couple of swigs won’t kill him. Kevin gulps it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: God, it’s just beer. Noah’s allowed to G@rink. “And hardér stuff than this.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (erupting) I don’t care what Noah does. You are not Noah.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Claire, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It’s just ... it’s a slippery slope, that’s all.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You're right. Gary takes the beer from Kevin. Kevin rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So how ‘bout these seats, Kev?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What if I told you they’re ours this year?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You bought season tickets?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Sure did.  61.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: But you always said they’d be a waste because of how many games you'd miss.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Things change ... The crowd goes wild as the Blackhawks score. Gary and Kev jump to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Did you see that!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (whistling, calling) Way to go, Kopecky!! Gary and Kevin high-five. Gary sits down, sips his beer. eyes are on the game, deliberately avoiding Claire’s gaze

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What’s changed?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You said things change.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Did I? His eyes twinkle with mischief.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Okay, out with it. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I left Keener & Wales.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Were you fired?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No, just thought it was time for a change. I took a position at a smaller firm where I won’t have to travel anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Cool!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is dark and quiet. Claire and Gary sit at the table over cups of coffee.  62.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I told them I want to focus on developing local projects _and they’re fine with that. I can even work from home if I want. CLAIRE ; I’ve never seen you so excited about your job before.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It’s more than the job. It’s like I've taken back control of my life. He takes her hands in his.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We're not getting any younger, Claire. Kev’1ll be off to college in a couple years. I don’t want to waste any more time being apart. She_ stares at their intertwined fingers - their wedding still on their fingers.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Do you think you'll ever be able to love me again?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh, Gary. I’ve never stopped loving you. She caresses his face and pulls him to her, kissing him softly, then more and more passionately -- until there’s stopping. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - MASTER BEDROOM —- NIGHT Claire and Gary move together, making love. They look int each other’s eyes, deeply connected. Suddenly, Claire gri him tightly, moans fervently.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Gary ... oh... Her sounds spur him on. He thrusts into her, overwhelmed wild desire for her. Claire thrills at his newly awakened aggression. She arch her back and grabs onto the headboard, white-knuckled, gasping for air, as_ items -- alarm clock, photos, books topple from the built-in shelves. They orgasm in unison, both crying out with pleasure. Gary collapses on top of her. They breathe together, thei bodies exhausted, their faces radiant.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You think we broke something?  63.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Naw, just give it a couple of minutes. He grins down at her. She hits him and slips into a fit o giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Gary sleep intertwined, deep contentment on th faces. Suddenly, LOUD MUSIC from’ outside wakes Claire. Claire creeps out of bed, careful not to wake Gary. She g to the window and peeks out. NOAH’S BEDROOM The lights are on, the window ajar. Noah appears, bare-chested. He unzips his jeans and wiggl out of them. Claire quickly turns away, about to close the curtains wh she hears a GIRL’S LAUGHTER. Claire turns back and sees:

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: in Noah’s room, kneeling down in front of Noah, her head moving back and forth rhythmically. She’s giving him a BLOW JOB. Claire stands there, frozen with shock -- a deer caught i the ambient light of Noah’s room. NOAH’S EYES FIX ON CLAIRE -- his face angry and spiteful. Horrified, Claire snaps the curtains shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire slides a plate of eggs in front of Gary. He looks invigorated, like a new man. She looks drained.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Thanks, honey. They look great. gary pulls Claire to him and kisses her. She gives hima hollow smile, then wanders to the coffee pot. Her eyes st out the window to Noah’s house. Kevin bounds down the stairs. His face lights up when he sees Gary. KEVIN ; Hey, Dad. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Well, I stayed over last night.  64.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Really? So ... what? Are things going back to normal around here? Kevin looks to Claire for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Yeah, honey. Dad’s coming home.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: If that’s okay with you.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Gary kiss good-bye. Gary’s lips linger, like a lover's.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I'll be home early.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Sounds good. Gary gets into his car and drives off. Claire waves, smil Claire turns to get into her own car and sees Noah glower at her from his driveway.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: What a fucking whore you are. Just like Kevin’s little girlfriend. Claire is stunned speechless. She scrambles into her car slams the door. She honks the horn. Kevin rushes out of the house with his backpack and cello

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I’m coming! He sees Noah. KEVIN ; Hey bro, you want a ride?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (out the window) Get in the car, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Claire) But I was just --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Get. In. The car. Kevin obeys, mortified. Noah smirks. Claire rolls up the window and backs out.  INT. CLAIRE’S EXPLORER (MOVING) - MORNING Kevin turns to Claire.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Jeez, what’s the big rush?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: We're going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: No we're not. They drive in silence for a long while.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Honey ... I'd like you to stay away from him.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: He’s a bad influence --

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Oh you’ve got to be --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: -- with all the fighting and --

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I told you, Zimmer started that.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin, you’re just going to have to trust me on this.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: No. You are not telling me who I can and can’t be friends with.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: He’s not your friend!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Stop the car.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Would you just listen to me for one --

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Stop the friggin’ car! Kevin starts to open the door, forcing Claire to stop. grabs his backpack and gets out.  66.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin, please don’t -- Kevin slams the door and stalks off down the street. Almost immediately, Noah’s Volvo pulls up to the curb ahe of Claire. The car door swings open and Kevin gets in. Claire watches them drive off. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Students laugh and chatter, ignoring the ringin bell. Claire races in, her eyes darting to Noah’s desk. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody -- Allie giggles with a HOT GUY behind her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Miss Cambridge, if you wouldn’t mind? Allie turns to the front with a smug smile.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (to the class) As I said last class, we’ll be watching “Oedipus the King” today. I advise you to pay attention. You’1l be tested on this. Claire inserts a DVD into a player and heads to the back a remote control.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Someone get the lights, please. Claire starts the movie as the lights go out. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - LATER Students’ attention wanes as the movie drones on.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: Oedipus and Jocasta (his wife and mother) embrace with jo upon hearing that the dreaded prophecy -- that Oedipus wo kill his father and sleep with his mother -- was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: JOCASTA
dialogues.text: As for marrying your mother, you are not the first man_to have dreamed that dream. Every man is his mother’s lover in imagination or in -- Just then, Jocasta’s words are replaced by the LUSTY MOAN A WOMAN.  67. Claire’s students stir with confusion, then erupt in gigg as it becomes clear that the dialogue has been dubbed ove with the FRENETIC SOUNDS OF TWO PEOPLE HAVING SEX. These kids can’t possibly recognize the lovers’ groans as Claire’s and Noah’s. But Claire does. She rushes to the DVD player, pounding on the remote. But the scene continues, the sex noises growing more feverish the second. The students hoot and holler as Claire frantically pushes buttons on the DVD player. Finally, the TV screen goes bl and the DVD pops out. But it’s total bedlam now.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Quiet! Now! Claire slams her hand down on her desk. The room goes sil except for a few lingering snickers.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Start on your homework. Claire hurries out, DVD in hand. The students erupt again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire storms in and locks herself in a stall. With a crazed look in her eye, she rips the DVD apart and throws the pieces into the toilet. She flushes with her foot over and over again, watching t shards gradually swirl down the drain. She looks down at her hands, trembling and bleeding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHISTLE blows and RUNNERS take off around the track. Claire, hands bandaged, tromps across the field to Noah, sits on the bleachers with a couple of other BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I need to speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I'm busy right now, Mrs. Peterson. With “P ysical Education. believe you're familiar with the subject. The boys snicker at his audacity.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Okay, you’re coming with me. She grabs his arm and jerks him to his feet.  68.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Ow, hey. Take it easy. His protests attract the attention of MR. SCHMIDT, the overweight P.E. Teacher, who stands some distance away. Claire pulls Noah over to the side of the bleachers.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You tape-recorded us?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Just for my own pleasure at first.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What is this? Are you trying to unish me? Because if you think or one minute that I’m -- Mr. Schmidt suddenly appears.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: Sandborn, you're up. Noah heads off. Mr. Schmidt lingers, an uneasiness in his __ MR. SCHMIDT ; Everything all right, Claire?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Yes. Fine. She hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire pulls in behind Gary’s car. Noah’s house looms ove her as she unloads groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONDAY NIGHT FOOTBALL blares from a TV as Claire lugs gro bags though the door. She sees boxes of Gary’s things stacked against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (calling) I’m home.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.8)
dialogues.text: In here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire enters to find Kevin and Gary eating pizza and watching he game. Kevin refuses to look her way.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Sorry I wasn’t here to help you with your stuff.  69.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It’s okay, the boys gave me a hand. O.S. a TOILET FLUSHES. Noah emerges from a nearby bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Peterson. Noah deliberately brushes up against her as he passes. He plops down on the couch next to Gary.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: What I miss?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It’s first and third. (to Claire) Come sit down, honey. Have some pizza.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, there’s plenty. Noah scoots over to create a space between himself and Ga He pats the couch.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Uh, no. I’ve got groceries ... She wanders out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire puts the groceries away. Noah enters and helps himself to a soda from the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Do we have any chips? He searches through the bags and pulls some out. Claire grabs them from him. CLAIRE oo, You can eat your own chips in your own home. She turns her back on him, stuffing the chips into the cupboard. He comes up behind her. Breathes on her.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Come over tonight. After they’re asleep. Say three o’clock.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Let’s see ... Who would you prefer I show our video to first? Gary? Or maybe ... (calling out) Kevin?  70.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah? Claire's tough facade instantly crumbles. Then, just as h about to call out to Kevin again:

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Don’t. Without taking his eyes off of Claire, Noah calls to Kevi

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You want a soda?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, and bring some chips. Noah reaches past Claire to the chips, pressing her again the counter.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I’1l leave a light on. He grabs another soda and heads back to Gary and Kevin, whistling a light-hearted tune. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - MASTER BEDROOM —- NIGHT In bed, Gary wakes from a sound sleep and reads the alarm 2:55 a.m. He rolls over and sees Claire’s side empty. He sits up, blinking in the dark, and spots Claire sittin chair in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Claire? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Come back to bed. Claire goes to him and sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Gary, you know how you said that people make mistakes? He nods, still half asleep.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I... while we were separated ...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Claire, I don’t need to hear this. I don’t want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We can’t keep dwelling on the past. It’s not good for us. He kisses her and pulls back the blankets.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Come on, get in. She does, reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh sweetie, you’re freezing. He spoons her, holding her tight, warming her. Her face i pained, guilt-ridden.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I love you, Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I love you, too. He kisses her head and closes his eyes, a content smile o his face. Claire stares straight ahead, wide awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell rings as Claire races to her classroom where students wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Sorry everybody. She unlocks the door and begins to open it. On the floor, just inside the doorway, she glimpses: A LARGE GLOSSY PHOTO OF HER AND NOAH HAVING SEX. Claire pushes the students back into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Give me a minute guys. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Claire steps inside and locks the door behind her. The SO of a COMPUTER PRINTER going full tilt, fills the room. She flicks on the lights and stares with horror. SEX PHOTOS are everywhere: papering the walls, sticking o of desks and file cabinets, stapled to the American flag. Scrawled across the chalkboard in a manic hand: “ONCE MORE I MUST BRING WHAT IS DARK TO LIGHT -- OEDIPUS KING, 804.”  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, students step aside for Headmaster Warren. He ba on Claire’s door and rattles the knob.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson?

dialogues.speaker: ALLIE
dialogues.text: She locked us out. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Claire races around gathering photos and stuffing them in her briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson, open this door.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (calling) Just a minute. She gathers the last of the photos and she goes for the d when she notices:

dialogues.speaker: THE PRINTER
dialogues.text: churning out an endless stream of SEX PHOTOS, each frame slightly different from the previous one -- a frame by fr chronicle of their one-night stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headmaster Warren pulls a KEY RING from his pocket and searches for the master. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Claire stuffs printer pages into a drawer, then yanks the plug of the printer from the wall. The machine dies in th midst of printing ONE LAST PHOTO. She hears the KEY TURNING THE LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headmaster Warren turns the knob just as Claire swings th door open, breathless and disheveled. Students push past her into the room. Her eyes follow the

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: What’s going on here? The bell rang five minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I must not have heard it.  73. She glances down and sees one of the photos, face down, under Headmaster Warren's foot.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: You_know classroom doors are not to be locked during school hours. He steps into the room and looks around. Claire barely breathes as Warren’s eyes travel past the partially printed photo in the printer and land on the Sophocles quote that Noah scribbled on the board. He turns back to Claire.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: I'd like to see you in my office after class.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: We’ll discuss it then. He turns to go when he finally notices the photo underfoo He bends to pick it up, but Claire gets to it first and quickly folds it up.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’ll be there. INT. WILKERSON PREP - HEADMASTER’S OFFICE - DAY Claire enters and is greeted by a haggard secretary, LORE

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: Go on in, hon. He should be back any minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire enters and sits in a guest chair, facing a long wa of cabinets labeled “STUDENT FILES.” Her eyes settle on t drawer labeled “R-S.” Claire glances through the open door to Loretta, who spea on the phone, her back turned. Claire sneaks to the cabinet and pulls open the file draw It SCREECHES. She freezes with panic, but hears Loretta still on the phone. She rifles through the files until finding Noah's. She pulls out a TRANSCRIPT from BAY VIEW HIGH SCHOOL in M All “A”s. In a section entitled “Disciplinary Action” the simply the entry “None.” She scans a “Family History” document and spots his mothe “Rebecca Sandborn” and the notation “Deceased” next to it  74. Her eye travels to his father’s name, “CHARLES SANDBORN.” Next to it, appears the same notation: “DECEASED.”

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Deceased?

dialogues.speaker: OUTER OFFICE
dialogues.text: Headmaster Warren enters, grabs some message slips from L

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson is waiting in your office.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Hold my calls. He peruses his messages as he goes into the:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire now sits innocently in the guest chair. Warren shu the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What’s this about, Ed? He sits down behind his desk, his face grim.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: I want to know what’s going on between you and Noah Sandborn.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Mike Schmidt reported an incident yesterday on the field.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh that ... It was nothing. I was reprimanding him. For skipping class.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Mike said you got physical with him. You grab! im.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I may have pulled his arm a little, just to get his attention ...

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: You know what our policy is regarding physical contact with students --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, but --  He slides such as: one great 75.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: Frankly, I’m more than a little concerned, what with the interest you took in him early on --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Interest? I did nothing more than I would for any student who wanted to be in my class.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: And then there’s this. her a photo of a wall covered in graffiti. Phrases “I fucked Mrs. Peterson” and “Claire Peterson is lay.” She stares in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: It was on the wall of the boys’ javatory across from your room. I’ve had it painted over but I intend to speak to the boys in your class about it. Including Noah.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Come on, Ed. You start questioning the boys and you’re just going to fuel the flames of a ridiculous rumor.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: This is a serious matter.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m sure I’m not the first teacher whose name has appeared on the bathroom wall. That’s what boys do.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: I’m not questioning your integrity, Claire. But we can’t tolerate even an appearance of impropriety without a thorough investigation. It’s for your own protection.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMASTER WARREN
dialogues.text: (shocked) Claire --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Let’s not pretend that this is anything more than you trying to cover your own ass. You talk to the boys and you can expect a call from my union rep. Claire storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks through the aisles, her eyes scanning for No  76. She seats herself at a faraway computer terminal and logs She accesses the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel newspaper archives. She types in the name “Charles Sandborn.” An OBITUARY from three years earlier pops up. hoto of “Charles Sandborn, 55” depicts a stern man Pith flinty ey and thin lips. Claire scans the article and we see the phrases: “SELF- INFLICTED GUNSHOT WOUND” and “RULED ACCIDENTAL.” Claire gapes at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Vicky huddle over their lunches in a faraway c

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: And now he’s threatening to show it to Gary if I don’t continue to ... go along.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, Claire. Vicky sits back, the wind knocked out of her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I can’t go to the police. They could arrest me for sleeping with a minor.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: That is such bullshit. He’s not some innocent little kid you took advantage of. He’s practically a grown man. And he knew exactly what he was doing.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m not so sure everybody would see it that way. They fall silent until a gang of rowdy kids passes.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You have to tell Gary.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You don’t really have a choice here.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: He’s been trying so hard. And this is the first time in years I feel like we’re really connected.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: He’s got to understand. You were separated, for Christ’s sake. If he hadn’t cheated on you in the first place ...  77.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You can’t blame him. I did this.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Okay, but you said yourself that people make mistakes. He loves you so damn much, let him prove it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: And what if Noah goes to the school with this video? “Or to the police?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Do you really think he’s going to put himself in the middle of a scandal like that?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. There’s something not right about him.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, no kidding ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: No, I mean, all this time he’s been pretending his father is alive. But I found his obituary. Noah’s father died three years ago. He accidentally shot himself while cleaning his gun.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I can’t take any chances with him, Vicky. I need to get that video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismissal time. The carpool lane is in full swing. INT. WILKERSON PREP - CLAIRE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Vicky puts on CLAIRE’S COAT and RED PLAID HAT AND SCARF w Claire watches Noah in the courtyard below.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: He’s out there. Make sure he sees you, but don’t get too close.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: How do I look? Claire turns around and examines Vicky. CLAIRE ; I wear my purse on my right. Vicky switches Claire’s purse from her left shoulder to h right. Claire hands her the keys to her SUV.  78.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I‘1l need about an hour.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky walks_to_the parking lot, head bowed. From a distan looks exactly like Claire. Noah spots her and watches her Vicky gets into Claire’s SUV and drives away. Noah follow in his Volvo. A moment later, Claire emerges from the school and gets i VICKY’S MUSTANG. INT. CLAIRE’S SUV - DAY In her mirror, Vicky sees Noah’s Volvo several cars behin

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Come on, honey. We're going for a nice little ride. She turns onto the Interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire parks Vicky’s Mustang in the garage, shuts the doo EXT. NOAH’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - DAY Claire tries Noah’s door, then a couple of windows. Locke She scours the rest of the house when she notices --

dialogues.speaker: A ROSE-COVERED TRELLIS
dialogues.text: leading to a small second-story window left open a crack. She climbs up, thorns piercing her skin, rotted wood crac with every step. At the top, she can’t quite reach the window. She crawls onto the steeply slanted roof and inches her way to the window, steadying herself with one foot in the gutter. Claire pries open the window when suddenly the gutter giv way. a e grabs the windowsill as the gutter clatters fo t ground. Claire hangs there, gathering strength, then hoists herse up and through the opening. INT./EXT. CLAIRE’S SUV - DAY Claire’s SUV_drives along with Noah not far behind. Vicky sees the fuel light come on.  79.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh great. INT. NOAH’S HOUSE - NOAH’S BEDROOM - DAY Claire enters and glances at the unmade bed, remembering: She rummages through Noah’s desk drawers, but finds nothi She slams the last drawer and scans the room, deciding wh to search next. Her eyes pass over the LeBron James poste and that’s when sees it: A TINY HOLE in LEBRON JAMES’S EYE. Claire climbs onto a chair to examine it. The hole in the poster extends into the wall where she sees the glint of CAMERA LENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky pumps gas. Out of the corner of her eye, she sees Noah’s Volvo idling on the side of the road. She turns around to replace the nozzle in the pump. When turns back, NOAH’S CAR IS GONE. INT. NOAH’S HOUSE - NOAH’S BEDROOM - DAY Claire opens a CLOSET DOOR. She moves boxes stacked on a and finds a CAMCORDER. She opens the compartment where it TAPE should be ... but it’s empty. Just then, Claire’s cell phone rings. She sees it’s Vicky and answers.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I lost him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I stopped for gas and I think he figured it out. He’s probably headed back right now.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: But I haven’t found the video.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Just get the hell out of there. Right now! INT. NOAH’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY Claire hurries down the stairs and heads toward the back when she hears the muffled sound of a COMPUTER PRINTER. S follows the noise to a door and opens it.  80. Stairs lead to a DARK BASEMENT. Claire hesitates, looks o the empty driveway, then flicks on the light and goes dow INT. NOAH’S HOUSE - BASEMENT - DAY Through the shadows, Claire follows the noise to a WOODEN DOOR. She pushes it open with a STALE CREAK to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL WORKROOM
dialogues.text: outfitted with a computer and printer. The printer churns calibrating itself. Claire stops it. Claire moves the computer mouse and Noah’s desktop appear clicks on the HARD DRIVE and scans its contents. She sees it almost immediately: A FOLDER LABELED “CLAIRE. She opens it and finds hundreds of candid photos of herse The early photos capture Claire performing mundane tasks: gardening, unloading groceries, taking out the trash. But gradually they become more intimate. There’s Claire r in bed, eating dinner with Kevin, kissing Gary, and then UNDRESSING FOR NOAH AT HER BEDROOM WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Bastard. She scrolls down and lets out a tiny gasp when she sees a FILE. And from its thumbnail it’s clear that this is what been looking for. Claire drags the movie file and the photos to the trash a hits the “SECURE EMPTY TRASH” button. A message warns that the files will be permanently delete Without hesitation, she hits the delete button. Claire closes the empty folder and is about to put the co back to sleep when she spots a FOLDER LABELED “MARISSA” Claire opens it and sees scores of candid photos of a PRE FAIR-HAIRED WOMAN in her early thirties. Claire zeros in on a series of photos taken in rapid succ - Marissa exits a red brick building, teenagers all about - She walks to a waiting car. - She gets in on the passenger side. - She kisses the man who is driving. Claire enlarges a photo that includes the building: The w “BAY VIEW HIGH SCHOOL” are carved in the stone pediment. Claire hits the print button and the printer comes to lif But just as suddenly, it stops. The display: “Add Paper.”  81.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Damn it. She rummages, finds a few stray sheets and shoves them in The printer churns out part of the photo, then grinds to halt. “Paper Jam.” With growing panics Claire slams various compartments and trays until the printer resumes and spits the photo out. Claire grabs it and runs from the room. INT. NOAH’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY Claire emerges from the basement, ready to get the hell o Dodge, when she sees THE MAN she once thought was Noah’s at the front door. She panics and tries to duck out of sight but it’s too la He waves to her through the window and waits at the door. She has no choice but to answer it. NOAH’S FATHER Hi there. Is Noah around?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Uh, no... NOAH’S FATHER Jim Robie. Premiere Real Estate. He hands her a business card complete with his photo and title: “Licensed Broker.” Claire stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: JIM ROBIE
dialogues.text: And you are?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: «+. the cleaning woman.

dialogues.speaker: JIM ROBIE
dialogues.text: Oh. Great. Well, would you mind seeing he gets this? It’s a copy of the recorded deed. For his files. He hands her an envelope. She looks anxiously past him to the street, expecting Noah to pull up at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Of course. She starts to close the door, but Robie puts a hand to it He looks her over, head tilted with curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: JIM ROBIE
dialogues.text: You don’t look like a cleaning woman .

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I used to be a teacher. Before the budget cuts. He nods thoughtfully, then heads to his car.  82. When he pulls away, Claire drops the envelope onto the welcome mat, and sprints across the lawn and into her hou INT. CLAIRE’S EXPLORER - DAY Vicky pulls Claire’s SUV into the driveway of her ranch-s house and parks. She bends down to gather her things. Whe comes back up:

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: is standing at her window wearing a bone-chilling smile.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Yes, I’m looking for a teacher, I think. Her name’s Marissa. I don’t know her last name, but --

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m not authorized to speak about the incident. You'll have to call back during school hours when Principal Brodie is in.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. What incident? The secretary hangs up, leaving Claire blinking with conf

dialogues.text: A TV plays in the background as Claire finishes the dishe She dries her hands and peeks into the family room where has nodded off in front of the TV.

dialogues.text: Claire sits at the desk and flicks | jon a computer. She Googles “Bay View teacher Marissa. Several news sites pop up. Claire clicks on Milwaukee's “FOX6NOW.COM.” A news headline, dated two months earlier, appears on the screen: “BOYFRIEND CONVICTED IN BAY VIEW TEACHER’S MURDER” Below it is a VIDEO WINDOW. Claire hits “play.” ON SCREEN a REPORTER speaks into a microphone outside a courthouse.  83.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here in downtown Milwaukee, a jury has just returned a guilty verdict against Alex Jacoby for the murder Bay View High School teacher, Marissa Sheldon. A photo of a Marissa appears. And only now does Claire recall seeing her photo on the news that first day of sch

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Sheldon was found bludgeoned to death in her apartment last May. Detectives quickly zeroed in on Jacoby, her live-in boyfriend, as a prime suspect.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Claire? Startled, Claire clicks off the site.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh, just checking email. She clicks onto her email account just as Gary comes arou behind her. He rubs her shoulders, kisses her neck.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You okay? You feel tense.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Been a long day.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s go up. I’1l give you a nice, long back rub. Gary pulls Claire to her feet and leads her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gray light of dawn filters in. Claire slips out of be while Gary sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sticks a note on the refrigerator: “Early | mornin faculty meeting. Completely forgot. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire backs Vicky’ s Mustang out of the driveway, glanci nervously at Noah’s sleeping house.  84. INT. VICKY’S MUSTANG - MORNING (MOVING) Claire listens to Vicky’s recorded greeting on her cell phone, then leaves a message.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Vicky, I’ve got to go out of town for the ey; I’‘ll drop off your car and fill you in on the details when I get back. Tell Warren I’m sick, would you? Thanks. She hangs up and follows the interstate highway sign for MILWAUKEE WISCONSIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red brick building from the photo. It sits on a busy city block. No sprawling lawns here. Claire pulls into an overcrowded lot. INT. BAY VIEW HIGH SCHOOL - PRINCIPAL’S OFFICE - DAY Claire sits across the desk from PRINCIPAL HELEN BRODIE,

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BRODIE
dialogues.text: Marissa was a gifted teacher. Young, energetic. The students loved her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Did she ever mention having difficulty with a student named Noah Sandborn? Brodie’s eyes become alert although her voice remains cas

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BRODIE
dialogues.text: Noah Sandborn ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You must remember him. He was here through his junior year. Before transferring to Wilkerson Prep this fall.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BRODIE
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. A wonderful student. Very bright, as I recall. Top of his class. CLAIRE ; I’m sure. But I was hoping to talk to you off the record.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BRODIE
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Noah Sandborn has been a problem at Wilkerson. He’s been extremely aggressive. Sexually. Toward certain female faculty members.  85.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BRODIE
dialogues.text: I can assure you we experienced no such problem with him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh really. Claire thrusts the photo of Marissa Sheldon at her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I found this on his computer. There are hundreds more. All of Marissa. Principal Brodie stares at the photo, her mind calculatin

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: He was stalking her --

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BRODIE
dialogues.text: Oh, this doesn’t --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: -- and I suspect there was something going on between them.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BRODIE
dialogues.text: Absolutely not!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Perhaps you were unaware.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BRODIE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson, I run a tight ship here. I certainly would have been alerted to any such impropriety. Just then there is a quick knock at the door and RHONDA SALAZAR, 27, fresh-faced but plain, enters.

dialogues.speaker: RHONDA
