dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You bitch! She dives for the knife but before she can reach it, Noah grabs her hair and yanks her to her feet. He pushes her up against a WEATHERED WOODEN FENCE -- a fl barrier between them and the RAVINE.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I loved you! Noah clamps his hands around Claire’s throat and slowly squeezes the life out of her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Please. Noah ... Suddenly, off screen there’s an almost INHUMAN ROAR. Noah turns to see Kevin charging toward them.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER FUCKER
dialogues.text: Kevin rams Noah against the fence with A CRACK and lands few blows to Noah’s already mangled face. Noah rallies, grabbing Kevin by the shirt and swinging hi around against the fence with ANOTHER CRACK. Noah pummels him in the gut. Kevin stays on his feet but

dialogues.speaker: THE FENCE
dialogues.text: splinters with each blow until finally, with the last pun gives way. The boys go tumbling over the side of the clif

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: No! Claire dashes to the cliff'’s edge and peers down into th abyss. She can make out only the vague contours of a NARR OUTCROPPING OF ROCK about fifteen feet below.  103.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (parely audible) Mom ...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Hang on! Claire finds Noah’s knife and cuts the rope of the tire s with it. She ties one end to a tree and sends the other e over the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Can you reach the rope? After a moment, there’s a tug.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Good. Now climb up. She sits on the ground and coils the rope around her hand Kevin’s weight is almost too much for her, but she holds fast, taking up the slack whenever she can. After a few moments, she sees his hand reach up over the edge. Claire grabs his wrist and pulls him up. As the top of his head emerges from the darkness, he lets a small GRUNT OF EXERTION. Claire stops cold, unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: / CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin? He turns his blood-covered face up to her. And it’s not Kevin’s eyes she’s looking into. IT’S NOAH. Claire recoils and releases his wrist. As Noah slides over the edge, he grabs Claire’s foot, dra her with him. She snags the rope just before going over.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE SIDE OF THE CLIFF
dialogues.text: Claire dangles from the rope with Noah clinging to her. S squirms and kicks, but he’s attached to her like a leech. After a moment, he begins a slow and steady climb up the length of Claire’s bo ly. His fingers rip her clothes, di into her flesh. Her grip grows weaker by the second.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I can't hold on. He presses his lips to her ear, hissing.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Let go.  104. But she doesn’t. And he hoists himself up to solid ground Noah crouches down and extends his hand to her. Claire stares up at him defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I’d never do anything to hurt you, Claire. Claire’s HANDS SLIP.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You can trust me. His face is as innocent as a choirboy’s. Claire hesitates, then reaches out and grasps his hand. S gives a hint of a smile before her grip tightens.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: But you can’t trust me. NOAH’S EYES widen with surprise as Claire yanks him over the cliff. He lets out a BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAM as his body bounces o the outcropping of rocks and plummets to the bottom of th ravine. Claire hangs there, gasping for breath. Then she slowl climbs up. Fighting back tears, she peers into the ravine

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Kevin! But there’s no response. Claire falls to her knees and wa with despair. Then, suddenly there’s weak cry.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom .... Claire sees the rope MOVING. She peers into the ravine an sees Kevin climbing up. When he nears the top, Claire reaches out for him. THEIR HANDS clasp together, united. Claire pulls Kevin to safety. Now on solid ground, Kevin falls into his mother’s arms. They hold each other as SIRENS WAIL in the distance. FADE OUT.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A “SOLD” sign is staked on the snow-covered lawn. Claire Kevin load boxes into a U-Haul trailer.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You got everything?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Except for my laptop. He runs off to the house. A POSTAL TRUCK pulls up and a MAILMAN hops out.

dialogues.speaker: MAILMAN
dialogues.text: Need a signature. Claire signs for it. He hands her an envelope and drives Claire stares at the return address: ILLINOIS STATE BOARD EDUCATION. She opens it and unfolds an official looking letter. She reads: “We hereby inform you that your teaching license h been permanently revoked.” Claire smiles sadly and folds up the letter. She glances at the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and dusty. The automatic garage door opens. Claire enters and looks around for anything she might hav left. She spots a small box containing dormant flower bul

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Honey? Claire looks up and sees Gary, a jagged scar visible on h scalp, his movements stilted is if still nursing his woun

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You about ready to go? Claire goes to Gary. They wrap their arms around each oth and walk to the car where Kevin waits. We remain in the garage as the automatic door descends, leaving us in total darkness. FADE OUT.
